### <a href="https://codeforces.com/problemset/problem/1293/B" target="_blank">Day 10: JOE is on TV!</a>

You can notice that the optimal strategy is that in each turn one opponent fail
to answer. Then, our answer is

$$\frac{1}{n} + \frac{1}{n - 1} + \frac{1}{n - 2} + \dots + \frac{1}{1}$$

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem10" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem10" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

#define all(A) begin(A), end(A)
#define rall(A) rbegin(A), rend(A)
#define sz(A) int(A.size())
#define pb push_back
#define mp make_pair

using namespace std;

typedef long long ll;
typedef pair <int, int> pii;
typedef vector <int> vi;
typedef vector <ll> vll;

int main () {
  ios::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(0);
  int n;
  cin >> n;
  long double sum = 0;
  for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
    long double x = i;
    sum += 1.0 / x;
  }
  cout << fixed << setprecision(12) << sum << '\n';
  return (0);
}
```

### <a href="https://codeforces.com/contest/181/problem/B" target="_blank">Day 09: Number of Triplets</a>

If you fix $A, C$ with two `fors`, you can get what value of $B$ you need.
Moreover, as all the points are integers, we can check if $A_x + C_x \land A_y + C_y$ are even in order to avoid working with floats. Now, we have fixed $B = ((A_x + C_x) / 2, (A_y + C_y) / 2)$ and we need to check if this point is in the input. We can do it with a set (you'll get TLE with a map) and solve the problem in $O(n^2 \log n)$.

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem09" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem09" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

using namespace std;

int main () {
  int n;
  cin >> n;
  vector <pair <int, int>> point(n);
  set <pair <int, int>> st;
  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
    cin >> point[i].first >> point[i].second;
    st.insert(point[i]);
  }
  int ans = 0;
  for (int a = 0; a < n; a++) {
    for (int c = a + 1; c < n; c++) {
      pair <int, int> b;
      int x = point[a].first + point[c].first;
      int y = point[a].second + point[c].second;
      if (x % 2 or y % 2) continue;
      b.first = x / 2;
      b.second = y / 2;
      if (st.count(b)) ans++;
    }
  }
  cout << ans << endl;
  return (0);
}
```

  </div>
  <!-- ends code -->

Furthermore, you can check if a point is in the input in $O(1)$ storing the points in a matrix of booleans. But, as the coordinates can take negative values in $[-1000, 1000]$ you can associate to each number $(x, y) \to (x + 1000, y + 1000)$ (this is a biyection). Using it, each coordinate is non-negative, so we can store it in our matrix.

</div>
</div>
</div>

### <a href="https://codeforces.com/problemset/problem/652/B" target="_blank">Day 07: z-sort</a>

Sort the array and alternate taking elements (the smallest, the greater, the
second smallest, the second greater, ...).

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem07" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem07" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

using namespace std;

int main () {
  int n;
  cin >> n;
  vector <int> arr(n);
  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) cin >> arr[i];
  sort(begin(arr), end(arr));
  int l = 0, r = n - 1;
  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
    if (i % 2 == 0) cout << arr[l++];
    else cout << arr[r--];
    cout << " \n"[i == n - 1];
  }
  return (0);
}
```

  <!-- ends code -->

### <a href="https://atcoder.jp/contests/abc122/tasks/abc122_c" target="_blank">Day 06: GeT AC</a>

We can count how many `AC` there are in a range using prefix sums and taking
care or corner cases.

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem06" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem06" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

#define all(A) begin(A), end(A)
#define sz(A) int(A.size())

using namespace std;

typedef long long ll;

int main () {
  ios::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(0);
  int n, q;
  cin >> n >> q;
  string s;
  cin >> s;
  vector <int> ac(n + 1, 0);
  for (int i = 1; i < n; i++) {
    if (s[i - 1] == 'A' and s[i] == 'C') {
      ac[i + 1] = 1;
    }
  }
  for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
    ac[i] += ac[i - 1];
  }
  while (q--) {
    int l, r;
    cin >> l >> r;
    int x = ac[r] - ac[l - 1];
    if (ac[l] - ac[l - 1] == 1) x--;
    cout << x << '\n';
  }
  return (0);
}
```

  <!-- ends code -->

### <a href="https://codeforces.com/contest/1266/problem/A" target="_blank">Day 05: Competitive Programmer</a>
$60 = 3 * 5 * 2 * 2$. Then, to verify that we can construct a number multiple of $60$ it is enough to
verify:

  * It is multiple of 3: the sum of digits is multiple of 3
  * It is multiple of 5 and 2: It ends in 0
  * It is multiple of 4: the last two digits are multiple of 4

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem05" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem05" class="collapse">
```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
#define all(A) begin(A), end(A)
#define rall(A) rbegin(A), rend(A)
#define sz(A) int(A.size())
#define pb push_back
#define mp make_pair
using namespace std;
typedef long long ll;
typedef pair <int, int> pii;
int main () {
  ios::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(0);
  int n;
  cin >> n;
  while (n--) {
    string s;
    cin >> s;
    if (sz(s) == 1) {
      if (s[0] == '0') cout << "red\n";
      else cout << "cyan\n";
      continue;
    }
    int zero = 0;
    int sum = 0;
    for (auto ch: s) zero += (ch == '0'), sum += (ch - '0');
    if (sum % 3 or !zero) {
      cout << "cyan\n";
      continue;
    }
    if (zero > 1) {
      cout << "red\n";
      continue;
    }
    bool ok = false;
    for (char ch: s) {
      if (ch == '0') continue;
      int num = (ch - '0') * 10;
      if (num % 4 == 0) ok = true;
    }
    if (ok) cout << "red\n";
    else cout << "cyan\n";
  }
  return (0);
}
```
  </div>
  <!-- ends code -->
</div>
</div>
</div>
<!-- ends problem 05 -->

### <a href="https://atcoder.jp/contests/abc135/tasks/abc135_b" target="_blank">Day 04: 0 or 1 Swap</a>

Try every $i, j$. This solution is $O(N^3)$ and as $N \leq 50$ it is enough.

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem04" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem04" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

#define all(A) begin(A), end(A)
#define rall(A) rbegin(A), rend(A)
#define sz(A) int(A.size())

using namespace std;

typedef long long ll;
typedef pair <int, int> pii;

int main () {
  ios::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(0);
  int n;
  cin >> n;
  vector <int> arr(n);
  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) cin >> arr[i];
  vector <int> s = arr;
  sort(all(s));
  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
    for (int j = i; j < n; j++) {
      swap(arr[i], arr[j]);
      if (arr == s) {
        cout << "YES\n";
        return (0);
      }
      swap(arr[i], arr[j]);
    }
  }
  cout << "NO\n";
  return (0);
}
```

  </div>
  <!-- ends code -->

</div>
</div>

### <a href="https://atcoder.jp/contests/abc148/tasks/abc148_d" target="_blank">Day 03: Brick Break</a>

The problem is basically to find the largest continuous segment $[l, r] \mid a[l + i] = i + 1, 0 \leq i \leq r - l$. Notice that we can do it in $O(n)$.

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem03" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem03" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

#define all(A) begin(A), end(A)
#define rall(A) rbegin(A), rend(A)
#define sz(A) int(A.size())
#define pb push_back
#define mp make_pair

using namespace std;

typedef long long ll;
typedef pair <int, int> pii;

int main () {
  ios::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(0);
  int n;
  cin >> n;
  int cnt = 0;
  int cur = 1;
  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
    int elem;
    cin >> elem;
    if (elem == cur) cur++, cnt++;
  }
  int need = n - cnt;
  if (need <= n - 1) cout << need << '\n';
  else cout << -1 << '\n';
  return (0);
}
```

  </div>
  <!-- ends code -->

</div>
</div>
</div>
<!-- ends problem 03 -->

### <a href="https://codeforces.com/contest/1238/problem/A" target="_blank">Day 02: Prime Subtraction</a>

If $x - y = 1$ then the answer is no, else, by the fundamental theorem of
arithmetic $\exists \, p$ prime $: p | (x - y)$. So, the answer is yes.

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem02" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem02" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

using namespace std;

int main () {
  int tc;
  cin >> tc;
  while (tc--) {
    long long x, y;
    cin >> x >> y;
    if (x - y == 1) cout << "NO\n";
    else cout << "YES\n";
  }
  return (0);
}
```

  <!-- ends code -->

### <a href="https://codeforces.com/problemset/problem/1111/A" target="_blank">Day 01: Superhero Transformation</a>

Let $f(c) = 1$ if `c` is as vowel and $f(c) = 0$ otherwise. Then, the answer is
true iff $|s| = |t| \land f(s[i]) = f(t[i]) \quad \forall i \in [0, n)$.

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem01" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem01" class="collapse">
  
```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

using namespace std;

int f (char c) {
  if (c == 'a' or c == 'e' or c == 'i' or c == 'o' or c == 'u') return 1;
  return 0;
}

int main () {
  string s, t;
  cin >> s >> t;
  if (s.size() != t.size()) {
    cout << "No" << '\n';
    return (0);
  }
  bool ok = true;
  for (int i = 0; i < s.size(); i++) {
    if (f(s[i]) != f(t[i])) ok = false;    
  }
  if (ok) cout << "Yes\n";
  else cout << "No\n";
  return (0);
}
```
  </div>
  <!-- ends code -->

</div>
</div>
</div>
<!-- ends problem 01 -->
